Author: Regnar#6164
Content: @xRobeSx any idea on a general turn around time on dPoW for a bitcoin protocol coin? I understand it varies, but any baseline would be useful.

Author: xRobeSx#5136
Content:
i'm not sure the amount of code that is necessary to be added to the new coin, but james did it for GAME, so I'm sure the PR's can be somewhat copied to the new coin. 

Basically you just have to get all the Notary Node's to install it on their servers. That takes a day or so to get everyone doing it and synced

Author: Regnar#6164
Content: Okay so likely not month long, or something that will take too much effort away from KMD core development/scaling etc

Author: xRobeSx#5136
Content: and the amount of time it takes for the coin's dev team to accept the PR and update their network to the new code

Author: Regnar#6164
Content: I am assuming there would be a review period though, in which a KMD dev goes through their code to see if there is anything blatantly malicious or wrong in it that could hurt KMD or notaries etc

Author: xRobeSx#5136
Content: I think most of it can be done without KMD core team doing much. The updates for iguana are minimal, its just getting the dpow code into the coin and NN's running it

Author: xRobeSx#5136
Content: yes @Regnar thats important too. We've discussed it would be dangerous if the NN's just blindly install someone's coin and then update it without reviewing

Author: xRobeSx#5136
Content: I guess thats why james recommends legit dev team coins first

Coin devs can look at Chips or GAME to see what is required (we should get the github links for them that show the code added just so we have it on hand).
